name: Monarch
description: The monarch butterfly is one of the most recognizable and well-studied butterflies on the planet. Its orange wings are laced with black lines and bordered with white dots. The caterpillar feeds on milkweed, which makes it poisonous to predators. The adult butterfly can be found in a variety of habitats, from forests to meadows to gardens. Monarchs are known for their long migrations, which can cover thousands of miles. They are found throughout North and South America, as well as in Australia, New Zealand, and other parts of the world.

name: Swallowtail
description: The swallowtail butterfly is a large, colorful butterfly that is found in many parts of the world. It is known for its distinctive tail-like extensions on its hindwings, which give it its name. The caterpillar feeds on a variety of plants, including citrus trees, fennel, and parsley. The adult butterfly can be found in a variety of habitats, from forests to meadows to gardens. Swallowtails are known for their graceful flight and their bright colors, which can range from yellow and black to blue and red. They are found throughout North and South America, as well as in Europe, Asia, and Africa.

name: Blue Morpho
description: The blue morpho butterfly is a large, iridescent butterfly that is found in the rainforests of Central and South America. Its wings are a brilliant blue color, with black edges and white spots. The caterpillar feeds on a variety of plants, including bananas, guava, and passionflower. The adult butterfly can be found in the canopy of the rainforest, where it feeds on nectar from flowers. Blue morphos are known for their striking appearance and their rapid flight. They are found throughout Central and South America, as well as in Mexico and the Caribbean.

name: Painted Lady
description: The painted lady butterfly is a medium-sized butterfly that is found in many parts of the world. It is known for its bright orange wings, which are laced with black lines and bordered with white spots. The caterpillar feeds on a variety of plants, including thistles, mallows, and hollyhocks. The adult butterfly can be found in a variety of habitats, from meadows to gardens to urban areas. Painted ladies are known for their long migrations, which can cover thousands of miles. They are found throughout North and South America, as well as in Europe, Asia, and Africa.

name: Tiger Swallowtail
description: The tiger swallowtail butterfly is a large, colorful butterfly that is found in many parts of the world. It is known for its distinctive yellow and black stripes, which give it its name. The caterpillar feeds on a variety of plants, including cherry, ash, and willow. The adult butterfly can be found in a variety of habitats, from forests to meadows to gardens. Tiger swallowtails are known for their graceful flight and their bright colors, which can range from yellow and black to blue and red. They are found throughout North and South America, as well as in Europe, Asia, and Africa.

name: Papilusion
description: Le Papilusion est un papillon rare, célèbre pour ses ailes translucides qui créent des illusions visuelles fascinantes. Il vit principalement dans les forêts tropicales et est connu pour sa capacité à changer de couleur en fonction de la lumière.

name: Cabbage white
description: Le piéride du chou (Pieris rapae) est un petit papillon de couleur blanche avec des taches noires sur ses ailes avant. Les mâles ont des ailes complètement blanches, tandis que les femelles ont une petite tache noire sur chaque aile avant. Il est souvent vu dans les jardins et les champs, surtout au printemps et en été. Les chenilles de ce papillon se nourrissent principalement des feuilles de plantes de la famille des crucifères, comme les choux. Ce papillon est très commun en Europe, en Asie et en Amérique du Nord.

name: Red admiral
description: L'amiral rouge (Vanessa atalanta) est un papillon aux ailes d'un rouge vif avec des taches noires et blanches. Il est souvent vu dans les jardins et les forêts ouvertes. Les chenilles se nourrissent des orties et d'autres plantes communes. Ce papillon est très répandu en Europe et en Amérique du Nord.

name: Peacock
description: Le paon du jour (Inachis io) est un grand papillon aux ailes brunes ornées de motifs oculaires colorés. Les ailes arrière sont également dotées de magnifiques motifs qui ressemblent à des yeux de paon. Ce papillon est souvent vu dans les jardins et les bois et se nourrit principalement de prunelles et de raiponces.

name: Common blue
description: Le bleu commun (Polyommatus icarus) est un petit papillon aux ailes bleu vif chez les mâles, tandis que les femelles ont des ailes brunes avec des taches bleues. Il est souvent trouvé dans les prairies et les zones ensoleillées. Les chenilles se nourrissent principalement de trèfles.

name: Brimstone
description: Le citron (Gonepteryx rhamni) est un papillon de couleur jaune vif, souvent observé dès les premiers jours du printemps. Il a une forme distinctive en V sur les ailes. Les chenilles se nourrissent principalement des feuilles de buis.

name: Small tortoiseshell
description: La petite tortue (Aglais urticae) est un papillon aux ailes orange vif avec des taches noires et des bordures bleues. Très courant en Europe, il est souvent trouvé dans les jardins et les bois. Les chenilles se nourrissent des orties.
